detaileddescription.para: The transceiver must not be used after calling this function.

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the transceiver context structure to be de-initialized
if successfully deinitialize
if the transceiver pointer parameter is NULL

memberdef.argsstring: (UARTTransceiver_T *transceiver, HWHandle_T handle, uint8_t *rawRxBuffer, uint32_t rawRxBufferSize, enum UARTTransceiver_UartType_E type)
memberdef.name: UARTTransceiver_Initialize

briefdescription.para: Initializes the transceiver for the use with the passed UART or LEUART handle.

detaileddescription.para:
transceiver
a pointer to the transceiver context structure to be initialized
handle
the handle of the UART or LEUART to be used by the transceiver. The handle must be initialized before passing it here.
mode
The mode in which the transceiver will operate, i.e. synchronous or asynchronous.
@ rawRxBuffer The buffer which will be used by the transceiver internally to save the received bytes. It must not be NULL.

parameterdescription.para: The size of the rawRxBuffer. It must be larger than zero.
if successfully initialized
if any of the parameter is NULL
if the semaphores are not created (see UARTTransceiver_T.TxSemaphore and UARTTransceiver_T.RxSemaphore)
if you are trying to initialized the transceiver again

briefdescription.para: Function to loop the UART/LEUART callback.

detaileddescription.para: It is necessary for the UARTTransceiver to loop the UART/LEUART callback. This means, the middle-layer driver which uses UART/LEUART and UARTTransceiver must initialize UART/LEUART with a callback function which invokes this function in order to loop the callbacks from UART/LEUART to the transceiver.
The middle-layer driver may use the macro UART_TRANSCEIVER_DECLARE_LOOP_CALLBACK can be used to generate such a callback.

parameterdescription.para: The transceiver
The event which is notified by the callback

memberdef.argsstring: (UARTTransceiver_T *transceiver, uint8_t *buffer, uint32_t size, uint32_t *length, uint32_t timeout_ms)
memberdef.name: UARTTransceiver_ReadData

briefdescription.para: It reads the data received by the transceiver.

detaileddescription.para: The transceiver must be started and not suspended when calling this function.

In the synchronous mode, this call will return only after the End-of-Frame check function which is used by the transceiver returns true. This holds even if the number of the received bytes exceeds the given buffer size. In the asynchronous mode, the function copies the bytes which have been already received an returns immediately. In both cases, the number bytes saved to the given buffer never exceeds the given buffer size. If more bytes are available in the transceiver internal buffer, they will reside there.

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the transceiver
The buffer which the bytes are copied to.
The buffer size. Independent of the number of the bytes which the transceiver has received, no more bytes are saved to the given buffer than the given size.
The number of received bytes which were saved to the given buffer.
in synchronous modeThe function will return with an error if this time elapsed before receiving the end of frame character
if successfully started
if any parameter is NULL
if the transceiver is not in an active state (see UARTTransceiver_State_E)
if semaphore could not be taken with given timeout (see UARTTransceiver_T.RxSemaphore)

briefdescription.para: It resumes the transceiver after it has been suspended.

detaileddescription.para: The transceiver must be suspended when calling this function.

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the transceiver to be resumed.
if successfully started
if transceiver pointer parameter is NULL
if the transceiver is not in an suspended state (see UARTTransceiver_State_E)

briefdescription.para: It activates the transceiver to start receiving and sending in the synchronous operation mode.

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the transceiver to be started.
A function pointer which is used by the transceiver to detect the end of the frame in order to invoke the callback.
if successfully started
if transceiver pointer parameter is NULL
if the transceiver is not in an initialized state (see UARTTransceiver_State_E)

briefdescription.para: It activates the transceiver to start receiving and sending in the asynchronous operation mode.

simplesect.para: Beside the operation mode, this function does the same as the function UARTTransceiver_Start().

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the transceiver to be started.
A function pointer which is used by the transceiver to detect the end of the frame in order to invoke the callback.
A callback function which will be invoked on RX and TX events, e.g. errors or operation completeness in the asynchronous mode.
if successfully started
if transceiver pointer parameter is NULL
if the transceiver is not in an initialized state (see UARTTransceiver_State_E)

detaileddescription.para: The transceiver must be started when calling this function. When the transceiver is stopped, read or write operations are not permitted. Resuming the transceiver after stopping it is not possible. It must be started using the UARTTransceiver_Start() function.

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the transceiver to be suspended.
if successfully started
if transceiver pointer parameter is NULL
if the transceiver is not in an active or already suspended state (see UARTTransceiver_State_E)

detaileddescription.para: The transceiver must be started when calling this function. When the transceiver is suspended read or write operations are not permitted.

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the transceiver to be suspended.
if successfully started
if transceiver pointer parameter is NULL
if the transceiver is not in an active state (see UARTTransceiver_State_E)

briefdescription.para: It writes the data for sending.

detaileddescription.para: The transceiver must be started and not suspended when calling this function.

In the synchronous mode, this call will return only after the passed bytes have been send over UART/LEUART. In the asynchronous mode, the function triggers the sending and returns immediately. A callback follows to inform about the success or failure of the send operation.

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the transceiver
The buffer which the bytes are copied to.
The buffer length and the number of bytes to be copied.
The time afterwhich if the function does not succeed for any reason it will return an semaphore error.
if successfully started
if any parameter is NULL
if the transceiver is not in an active state (see UARTTransceiver_State_E)
if semaphore could not be taken with given timeout (see UARTTransceiver_T.TxSemaphore)

memberdef.name: UART_TRANSCEIVER_DECLARE_LOOP_CALLBACK
memberdef.initializer: static BCDS_ALWAYS_INLINE void UARTTransceiverLoopCallback(UART_T uart, struct MCU_UART_Event_S event) \ { \ UARTTransceiver_LoopCallback(&transceiver, event);\ }

detaileddescription.para: The middle-layer driver, which uses UART/LEUART and UARTTransceiver, may use this macro in oder to generate a callback function to initialize UART/LEUART with it. The generated function loops the callback to the transceiver by calling the function UARTTransceiver_LoopCallback().

parameterdescription.para: The variable name of the transceiver. It must be a pointer to the context structure but the context structure itself.

briefdescription.para: Advanced API functions for sending and reveiving via UART and LEUART.

detaileddescription.para: The UARTTransceiver encapsulates the handling of buffers and the control flow.
The typical use of the UARTTransceiver starts with initializing it.

The transceiver supports two operation modes: synchronous mode and asynchronous mode.The transceiver is started in the synchronous mode by calling the function UARTTransceiver_Start(). In order to operate the transceiver in the asynchronous mode, the function UARTTransceiver_StartInAsyncMode() should be used instead. After the start, the transceiver starts to receive bytes, in the ISR context, and store them internally into a ring buffer. While receiving the transceiver applies the end-of-frame check function to every received byte. If it returns true, then the transceiver will perform one of the following action depending on its operation mode:
In the asynchronous mode, the registered callback is invoked to notify the upper-layer. The upper-layer will fetch the data from the transceiver's buffer using the function UARTTransceiver_ReadData().
In the synchronous mode, the upper-layer is expected to call UARTTransceiver_ReadData(). The call is blocking. When the end-of-frame check function returns true, the semaphore is released such that the call of UARTTransceiver_ReadData() returns, where the frame is copied into the buffer which was passed as a parameter.

The function UARTTransceiver_WriteData() sends data via the under-laying UART or LEUART. In the asynchronous mode, the write operation triggers the sending and returns. A callback follows to inform the upper-layer about the success or failure of the operation. In the synchronous mode, the write operation blocks until all bytes are sent. No callback will follow.

UARTTransceiver provides also the functions UARTTransceiver_Suspend(), UARTTransceiver_Resume(), UARTTransceiver_Stop() to control the activity of the transceiver, in particular the receiving activity in the background.

simplesect.para: UARTTransceiver is a passive component without an own task. It is driven by the caller task and the interrupts coming form UART or LEUART.

UARTTransceiver maintains its context in a struct which makes it ready for multiple-instance use. This means, multiple UARTTransceiver instances may co-exist in the same application. However, they must operate on different UART or LEUART ports.
